page.title: 13Customs in S'key & C'thorpe.
page.content:
{Old customs:} dying with local crafts e.g.rag rug-making, flint knapping and laying, concoction of building plaster. No longer a blacksmith; no longer local musicians; none of the old shops; no local pubs. Cockle gathering has shrunk because of low financial return; beginning of century enough work for 3 gangs of women, each gathering 5 pecks (10 gallons) per day, using special knives, dressed against wind, rain, cold with large brimmed hats tied round heads, mittens, neck warmers and over skirts tucked into boots. No longer seen. Lug-worm digging (average 100 worms per man-hour) survives on growing amateur fisher market.
{New customs:}growing up round Fete and Social Club e.g.Tug of War, Sports; Annual Parties.
